posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked:
Hey guys! I have an urgent issue, our competition is next Wednesday, and I just deployed the code to the new robot for the first time after updating the firmware on all the devices and setting up the rio and radio. The code (java) builds on our swerve drive code from our offseason robot, with the only changes being updating to match the most recent package versions for 2025 and adding a few subsystems. However, when deployed to the robot, I don’t see any of the data on our shuffleboard which I need to find the angle offsets for the swerve drive modules among other things. I’ve noticed when the code is first deployed, the following error pops up (The section between robot program starting and robot program startup complete) and I suspect that’s the cause of the issue: error 1564×770 120 KB However, I have no idea what this means or what I should do about it. Any help will be greatly appreciated!

error 1564×770 120 KB

error 1564×770 120 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
That error would be from libgrapple (I know because it’s the only vendordep that uses Rust, and the error line is this one: libgrapplefrc/grapplefrcdriver/src/can_bridge.rs at master · GrappleRobotics/libgrapplefrc · GitHub ).  I wouldn’t think it would prevent data from getting sent to Shuffleboard, however, since it looks like the robot main loop is running.

Almost all your code is commented out in RobotContainer, so it’s hard to see what even might be sending values?  Try adding a simple SmartDashboard.putNumber() call in robotPeriodic() and see if that comes through.

Also, try connecting with OutlineViewer or a different dashboard to see if you see the data there.

Note the early 2025 releases of Shuffleboard are a bit buggy, so if you’ve not installed 2025.3.1, I’d recommend doing that as well.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Ok, thank you for your help. We just recently added the lib grapple so it makes sense that that error is just now appearing. Sorry about the messy code, most of our data is being put on the shuffleboard in the periodic functions in the individual subsystems, such as the swerve subsystem. We’ve tried the smart dashboard and the default dashboard in addition to the shuffleboard, but the data doesn’t show there either. I will see if I can install a newer version of the shuffleboard, but do you know where I can find that installation? Do I just reinstall the newer version of wpilib using this page? WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked:
Ok, never mind. It turns out it was a careless mistake on my part. I checked what you mean’t by the robot container code was all commented out and I realized I forgot to uncomment some important parts of the code after I finished debugging. Thanks for pointing that out! I have another quick question though - We are getting a CAN frame not received/ too stale error on the driver station, but when I connect to and check the CAN bus through REV Hardware Client, it shows all the spark maxes without any problem. The only notable error on REV hardware is an error on the CAN bus itself, but I can’t imagine what that error would be since it the CAN seems to be behaving normally. Is there any way to debug this? IMG_1925 1920×2560 1.09 MB IMG_1926 1920×2560 524 KB

IMG_1925 1920×2560 1.09 MB

IMG_1925 1920×2560 1.09 MB

IMG_1926 1920×2560 524 KB

IMG_1926 1920×2560 524 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: The best way to debug this is to narrow down the issue by physically disconnecting devices off the bus.  It’s probably easiest to remove any sensors before starting to remove motors.
